title: Aircraft Noise Exceedances
description: A. SUMMARY San Francisco International Airport (SFO) monitors aircraft noise levels on the San Francisco Peninsula 24/7 for analysis and reporting. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Louder aircraft noise events are of particular interest. As a result, the Noise Exceedance dataset was developed from noise events correlated to SFO aircraft operations. An exceedance is a noise event greater than the defined maximum level thresholds for Daytime and Nighttime periods at each noise monitor site. One aircraft operation can cause noise events at numerous monitors, which may become noise exceedances. The maximum level thresholds for each noise monitor site are listed below. Site - Daytime (7 a.m. to 9:59:59 p.m.), Nighttime (10 p.m. to 6:59:59 a.m.) Site 1 - greater than 104.9 dBA, 94.9 dBA Site 2 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 3 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 4 - greater than 104.9 dBA, 94.9 dBA Site 5 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 6 - greater than 94.9 dBA, 84.9 dBA Site 7 - greater than 84.9 dBA, 74.9 dBA Site 8 - greater than 94.9 dBA, 84.9 dBA Site 9 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 10 - greater than 94.9 dBA, 84.9 dBA Site 11 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 12 - greater than 79.9 dBA, 69.9 dBA Site 13 - greater than 84.9 dBA, 74.9 dBA Site 14 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 15 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 16 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 17 - greater than 84.9 dBA, 74.9 dBA Site 18 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 19 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 20 - greater than 79.9 dBA, 69.9 dBA Site 21 - greater than 79.9 dBA, 69.9 dBA Site 22 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 23 - greater than 79.9 dBA, 69.9 dBA Site 24 - greater than 79.9 dBA, 69.9 dBA Site 25 - greater than 89.9 dBA, 79.9 dBA Site 26 - greater than 84.9 dBA, 74.9 dBA Site 27 - greater than 79.9 dBA, 69.9 dBA Site 28 - greater than 79.9 dBA, 69.9 dBA Site 29 - greater than 84.9 dBA, 74.9 dBA C. UPDATE PROCESS Data is available starting January 2005 and will be updated monthly. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET It is important to note, that this dataset is of SFO aircraft departing and/or landing at SFO correlated to a noise event and not flight activities associated with other airports in the Bay Area region. This information is the data source for the Exceedance figure in the Aircraft Noise Levels Summary section (page 1) of the Airport Director’s Report. This report is presented at the SFO Airport Community Roundtable Meetings and available online at https://noise.flysfo.com/reports/?category=airport-directors-report E. RELATED DATASETS Other provided datasets are Noise Exceedance Rating, Aircraft Noise Reports, Late Night Aircraft Departures, Air Carrier Runway Use, and Late Night Preferential Runway Use, Aircraft Noise Climates, and Flight Operations. Please contact the Noise Abatement Office at NoiseAbatementOffice@flysfo.com for any questions regarding this data. Date created: April 23, 2024 https://noise.flysfo.com/data-reports/published-reports/report-archive/?wdt_search=director

columns.name: location_id
columns.description: ID number assigned to a specific physical Remote Monitoring Terminal (noise monitor site).

columns.name: corr_id
columns.description: Number that links a flight operation record to a noise event record and/or noise report record.

columns.name: max_date_time
columns.description: Date/Time of maximum level of a noise event.

columns.name: classification
columns.description: Classification code for noise events: 1 – Single SFO Aircraft, 2 – Multiple SFO Aircraft, 3 – Non-SFO Aircraft, 4 – Simultaneous SFO and Non-SFO Aircraft, 5 - Community Noise, 6 – Simultaneous Community and SFO Aircraft, 7 – Simultaneous Community and Non-SFO Aircraft, 8 – Wind Noise.

columns.name: sel
columns.description: Sound Exposure Level of a noise event in 1 second duration (decibel A-weighted).

columns.name: max_level
columns.description: Maximum sound level of a noise event (decibel A-weighted).

columns.name: duration
columns.description: The length of a noise event in seconds.

columns.name: day_night
columns.description: Period when the noise event occurred. Day is 7:00 a.m. to 9:59:59 p.m. Night is 10:00 p.m. to 6:59:59 a.m.

columns.name: operation_no
columns.description: Unique number to identify individual flight track record.

columns.name: flight_date_time
columns.description: Date/Time the flight operation occurred (departed or arrived SFO).

columns.name: operation_type
columns.description: Identifies the flight operation: A=Arrival, D=Departure, O=Overflight, G=Ground, T=Touch&Go.

columns.name: runway_name
columns.description: The name of runway (i.e. 28R) that an aircraft operated on.

columns.name: aircraft_type
columns.description: Type of aircraft used for the flight operation.

columns.name: aircraft_category
columns.description: Aircraft categorized by letter into the following categories: B=Business, H=Helicopter, J=Jet, R=Regional, T=Turboprop Aircraft

columns.name: airline_code
columns.description: The aircraft operating company's 3‐letter International Civil Aviation Organization designator.

columns.name: airline
columns.description: The name of the aircraft operating agency.

columns.name: other_port
columns.description: Destination or Origination Airport Code for an operation.

columns.name: airport_code
columns.description: Destination or Origination Airport Code for an operation.

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Date and time source data was updated.

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Date and time of data load.

whom_it_may_interest: Residents near the airport, policymakers, and researchers focused on environmental noise pollution and its management.

queries.Monthly: SELECT location_id, classification, day_night, date_trunc_ym(max_date_time) AS month, COUNT(*) AS exceedance_count WHERE max_date_time >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY location_id, classification, day_night, month ORDER BY month, location_id, classification, day_night
queries.Yearly: SELECT location_id, classification, day_night, date_trunc_y(max_date_time) AS year, COUNT(*) AS exceedance_count WHERE max_date_time >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY location_id, classification, day_night, year ORDER BY year, location_id, classification, day_night
